data.title: Los Angeles Lakers Classics
data.text:
1972 Finals Game 5: Lakers clinch NBA title

Wilt Chamberlain scores 24 points and grabs 29 rebounds to secure Finals MVP and lead the Lakers to their first title since moving to California. The Lakers won a then-record 69 games during the regular season and cemented their legacy as one of the greatest teams ever.

1980 Finals- Game 6: Lakers vs 76ers

In what came to be the defining game of his decorated career, 20-year old rookie Magic Johnson starts at center in place of an injured Kareem Abdul-Jabbar and delivers 42 points as the Lakers win the 1980 title.

1980 Finals Game 5: Kareem's heroics lift Lakers

In a pivotal Game 5 against the Sixers, Kareem Abdul-Jabbar returns from an ankle injury to deliver down the stretch, capping a 40-point performance to put Los Angeles up 3-2.

1985 Finals- Game 6: Lakers vs Celtics

Kareem Abdul-Jabbar is front and center as the Lakers become the first visiting team to win a title in Boston Garden, ending the Celtics' championship dominance over Los Angeles.

1987 Finals- Game 4: Lakers vs Celtics

Magic Johnson hits the most famous shot of his career, a junior sky hook over the towering Celtics frontline with 2 seconds left, capping a brilliant Lakers comeback and giving them a commanding 3-1 series lead.

1988 Finals- Game 6: Pistons vs Lakers

Isiah Thomas delivers an inspiring and iconic Finals effort: overcoming a severe ankle sprain, Thomas sets a new Finals record for points in a quarter (25) as Detroit pushes the Lakers to the brink.

1988 Finals- Game 7: Lakers vs Pistons

Los Angeles uses a third quarter blitz and a 36-point triple-double from Big Game James Worthy to become the first team since the 1969 Celtics to go back-to-back.

1991 Finals Game 1: Perkins shot clinches classic

The Lakers take the opener of their highly-anticipated Finals matchup with the Bulls on a Sam Perkins go-ahead 3-pointer. Michael Jordan scores 36 points in his championship debut.

2000 Finals Game 4: Kobe Bryant takes over in OT as the Lakers secure 3-1 edge

Lakers C Shaquille O'Neal led the team with 36 points and 21 rebounds, and Kobe Bryant finished off the Pacers with baskets on three consecutive possessions in overtime.

2000 Finals Game 2: Shaquille O'Neal goes for 40 and 24 boards as the Lakers up 2-0

Shaquille O'Neal dominates with 40 points and 24 rebounds as the LA Lakers to defeat the Indiana Pacers and Jalen Rose, 30 points, 104-111 in Game 2 of the 2000 NBA Finals.

2001 Finals Game 2: Shaquille O'Neal and Kobe Bryant dominate (59 points) in win

Kobe Bryant and Shaquille O'Neal combine for 59 points as the LA Lakers defeated the Philadelphia 76ers and Allen Iverson, 23 points, 89-98 in Game 2 of the 2001 NBA Finals.

2001 Finals Game 3: Robert Horry's clutch 3-pointer gives Lakers 2-1 advantage

Kobe Bryant and Shaquille O'Neal combine for 62 points as the LA Lakers defeated the Philadelphia 76ers and Allen Iverson, 35 points, 96-91 in Game 3 of the 2001 NBA Finals.

2001 Finals Game 4: Shaquille O'Neal scores 34 points as the Lakers go up 3-1

Shaquille O'Neal's 34 points were enough for the LA Lakers to defeat the Philadelphia 76ers and Allen Iverson, 35 points, 100-86 in Game 4 of the 2001 NBA Finals.

2002 Finals Game 4: Shaquille O'Neal claims third straight Finals MVP as Lakers sweep Nets

Shaquille O'Neal scores 34 points and is awarded his third straight NBA Finals MVP, as the Lakers win their third consecutive NBA Championship.

2008 Finals Game 3: Kobe Bryant pours in 36 to help Lakers secure needed win

Kobe Bryant scored 36 points with an MVP-worthy performance, Sasha Vujacic added 20 points and the Lakers, teetering on the brink of falling into an impossible hole in the NBA Finals, beat the Boston Celtics 87-81 in Game 3.

2009 Finals Game 4: Fisher powers Lakers to OT win

Derek Fisher forced overtime with a 3-pointer with 4.6 seconds left in regulation and then drilled another with 31.3 seconds to go in overtime as the Los Angeles Lakers outlasted the Orlando Magic 99-91 in Game 4.

2009 Finals Game 5: Kobe Bryant leads the way as Lakers claim 15th NBA title

Lakers G Kobe Bryant scored 30 points to lead the Lakers to victory over the Magic. The Lakers won the 2009 Finals, 4 games to 1.

2010 Finals Game 1: Kobe Bryant and Pau Gasol lead the Lakers to victory in opener

Kobe Bryant scored 30 points to lead the Lakers in Game 1 of the Finals. Paul Pierce had 24 points and 9 rebounds for the Celtics.

2010 Finals Game 7: Lakers beat Celtics

The Los Angeles Lakers overcome a 13-point deficit in the third quarter to send the Boston Celtics packing in Game 7 of the 2010 NBA Finals.

2020 Finals Game 6: Lakers dominate Heat to end title drought

LeBron James goes off for a triple-double with 28 points, 14 rebounds and 10 assists to help the LA Lakers win their 17th championship over the Miami Heat and clinch NBA Finals MVP honors for the fourth time in his legendary career.

2020 Finals Game 2: Anthony Davis' stellar performance overwhelms Heat

LeBron James finished with 33 points, nine rebounds and nine assists, Anthony Davis made 14 of his first 15 shots on the way to 32 points, and the Lakers took a 2-0 lead in the title series by beating the short-handed Miami Heat 124-114.

2020 Finals Game 4: Lakers edge Heat, take commanding 3-1 lead

LeBron James finished with 28 points, 12 rebounds and eight assists, Anthony Davis' 3-pointer with 39.5 seconds left finally settled matters and the Lakers beat the Miami Heat 102-96 in Game 4.

2020 Finals Game 1: LeBron James, Anthony Davis pace Lakers to comfortable win

Anthony Davis scored 34 points, LeBron James had 25 points, 13 rebounds and nine assists and the Los Angeles Lakers rolled past the Miami Heat 116-98 in Game 1 of the 2020 NBA Finals.

10/12/79 - Start of a Magical Career

Magic Johnson scored 26 points in his anticipated debut, but the memorable moment came after Kareem Abdul-Jabbar's skyhook at the buzzer, with the two celebrating the start of what became an incredible season.

11/1/96: Shaq Diesel's Tinseltown Debut

11/1/96: Leaving the Magic Kingdom for Hollywood, Shaquille O'Neal's move to Los Angeles shook the league. Relive his memorable Lakers debut, where he shook the court, too.

2010 West Finals - Game 5: Lakers vs Suns

Metta World Peace - then known as Ron Artest - hits the buzzer beater in this classic from 2010, denying a Suns comeback and helping the Lakers take a 3-2 lead in the Western Conference Finals.

3/6/20: Lakers vs. Bucks - LeBron duels Giannis

In this much-anticipated clash of the league's two best teams, LeBron James scored 37 points to lead the Lakers past Giannis Antetokounmpo and the Bucks.

4/13/16: Lakers vs Jazz- Kobe's farewell

Kobe Bryant's final NBA game was one to remember: he scored 23 points in the fourth, 60 in the game, and reinforced his legacy as one of the game's greatest players.

3/6/00: Lakers vs Clippers- Shaq scores 61

Shaquille O'Neal celebrates his birthday in style by scoring a career-high 61 points against the Clippers.

1984 West Semis- Game 4: Lakers vs Mavs

Kareem Abdul-Jabbar scores 33 points to lead seven Lakers in double-figures as they capture an overtime win over the Mavericks in Dallas.
